storyTitle: As Employee, I want to submit schedule change requests to achieve timely updates to my work schedule

testCases.title: Validate successful schedule change request submission with valid input
preconditions: Employee is logged into the scheduling system
Schedule change request page is accessible
Test file (PDF/DOC) under 5MB is available for attachment
Database connection is active and ScheduleChangeRequests table is accessible

steps.action: Navigate to schedule change request page from the main dashboard
steps.expectedResult: Schedule change request form is displayed with all mandatory fields visible: Date, Time, Reason, and optional file attachment field. All fields are empty and ready for input

steps.action: Enter a valid future date in the Date field (e.g., tomorrow's date)
steps.expectedResult: Date is accepted and displayed in the correct format without validation errors

steps.action: Enter a valid time in the Time field (e.g., 09:00 AM)
steps.expectedResult: Time is accepted and displayed in the correct format without validation errors

steps.action: Enter a valid reason in the Reason field (e.g., 'Medical appointment')
steps.expectedResult: Reason text is accepted and displayed in the field without validation errors

steps.action: Click on the file attachment button and select a valid file (PDF/DOC) under 5MB
steps.expectedResult: File is successfully attached, file name is displayed, and no error messages appear

steps.action: Click the 'Submit' button
steps.expectedResult: Form is submitted successfully, confirmation message is displayed (e.g., 'Your schedule change request has been submitted successfully'), and the page shows submission timestamp

steps.action: Verify the request is logged in the system by checking the submission history or database
steps.expectedResult: Request appears in the submission log with correct timestamp, employee ID, and all submitted data including attached file

postconditions: Schedule change request is saved in ScheduleChangeRequests table
Request has a unique ID and timestamp
Request is forwarded to approval workflow
Employee can view the submitted request in their request history
System response time is under 2 seconds

testCases.title: Verify rejection of submission with missing mandatory fields
preconditions: Employee is logged into the scheduling system
Schedule change request page is accessible
Form validation rules are configured correctly

steps.action: Navigate to schedule change request page from the main dashboard
steps.expectedResult: Schedule change request form is displayed with all mandatory fields visible and empty

steps.action: Leave the Date field empty and click outside the field or tab to the next field
steps.expectedResult: Real-time validation triggers and highlights the Date field with a red border or indicator, displaying error message 'Date is required'

steps.action: Leave the Time field empty and click outside the field or tab to the next field
steps.expectedResult: Real-time validation triggers and highlights the Time field with a red border or indicator, displaying error message 'Time is required'

steps.action: Leave the Reason field empty and click outside the field
steps.expectedResult: Real-time validation triggers and highlights the Reason field with a red border or indicator, displaying error message 'Reason is required'

steps.action: Click the 'Submit' button with all mandatory fields still empty
steps.expectedResult: Form submission is blocked and prevented. Descriptive error messages are displayed at the top of the form and/or next to each empty mandatory field stating 'Please complete all required fields before submitting'

steps.action: Verify that no data is saved to the database
steps.expectedResult: No new record is created in the ScheduleChangeRequests table and no submission log entry exists

steps.action: Fill in only the Date field with a valid date and attempt to submit again
steps.expectedResult: Submission is still blocked with error messages displayed for the remaining empty mandatory fields (Time and Reason)

postconditions: No schedule change request is created in the database
Form remains on the screen with entered data preserved
Error messages are clearly visible to the user
User can correct the errors and resubmit
No partial or incomplete data is logged

testCases.title: Ensure draft save functionality works correctly
preconditions: Employee is logged into the scheduling system
Schedule change request page is accessible

steps.action: Navigate to schedule change request page from the main dashboard
steps.expectedResult: Schedule change request form is displayed with all fields empty and ready for input

steps.action: Enter a valid future date in the Date field (e.g., next week's date)
steps.expectedResult: Date is accepted and displayed without validation errors

steps.action: Enter a valid time in the Time field (e.g., 02:00 PM)
steps.expectedResult: Time is accepted and displayed without validation errors

steps.action: Leave the Reason field empty (partial data entry)
steps.expectedResult: Reason field remains empty without triggering validation errors since draft save does not require all mandatory fields

steps.action: Click the 'Save Draft' button
steps.expectedResult: Draft is saved successfully and a confirmation notification is displayed (e.g., 'Draft saved successfully' or 'Your changes have been saved as draft')

steps.action: Verify the draft timestamp is displayed on the form
steps.expectedResult: Last saved timestamp is visible on the form (e.g., 'Draft saved at 10:30 AM')

steps.action: Navigate away from the schedule change request page to another section of the application
steps.expectedResult: User successfully navigates to another page without losing draft data

steps.action: Return to the schedule change request page
steps.expectedResult: Form is displayed and automatically loads the previously saved draft data

steps.action: Verify that the Date field contains the previously entered date
steps.expectedResult: Date field displays the exact date that was entered before saving the draft

steps.action: Verify that the Time field contains the previously entered time
steps.expectedResult: Time field displays the exact time that was entered before saving the draft

steps.action: Verify that the Reason field is still empty as it was not filled
steps.expectedResult: Reason field remains empty, confirming partial data was correctly saved and restored

postconditions: Draft is saved in the database with status 'Draft'
Draft has a unique ID and timestamp
Previously entered data is preserved and retrievable
User can continue editing the draft or submit it after completion
Draft does not appear in the approval workflow until submitted
User can have multiple drafts if system allows
